body.p:
To his Excellency
Thomas E Bramlett
Governor of Kentucky

Claiborne Lisle respectfully states that on the 5th day of October 1861 he became bound as the surety of John B Lisle in a Recognisance Bond in the Penalty of $1000= for his appearance at the Novr Term 1861 -- of the Clark Circuit Court Kentucky to answer an Indictment therein, for Gaming. in which it was charged that $600= had been won & lost in 24 hours -- said John B Lisle appeared at the November Term 1861 but the case was continued and was also continued at the succeeding Term of said Court at the May & July Terms 1862 said John B Lisle being present at each of those Terms.

In the fall of 1862 he went into the Confederate service, and was not present at the November Term 1862 whereupon and the Bond aforesaid was declared Forfeited -- at the May Term 1863 Judgment was rendered upon the Forfeiture for the sum of $1000= against your petitioner

The said John M Lisle always asserted to and was beleived Petitioner not guilty of the charge against him; he continues in the Confederate service and has no Estate from which to indemnify his surety on the matter aforesaid

Wherefore your Excellency is respectfully solicited to release him from the payment of the
aforesaid Judgment of $1000=
Clairborne Lisle says he believes the foregoing Petition to be true January 27th 1864
The undersigned citisens of Clark County respectfully request that the Jugment therein mentioned in the foregoing Petition may be remitted. -- Jany Decr 267 1864.

Jn B Huston
P C Eubank
Tho. H. Robinson
Henry H Emerson
J. T. Garner
W. E. Rees
Daniel Smith
Theodore Kohlhass
E. T. Taylor
Robt Bush
John W Hart
Benj. F. Turner
Saml A Ramsey
Jas Flanagan
D S Cart
Fielding Burk
I fully concur in and request that the foregoing Petition be granted -- it is a case that justifies the remission and the gentlemen signing Petition are all worthy good citizens

Petition of C Lisle for Judgt in case of John B Lisle
